results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Thursday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

results.description:
Are you using predictive approaches to truly leveraging customer analytics? If not, I highly recommend this webinar where we’ll review predictive analytic approaches to common customer analytics tasks such as predicting likelihood to purchase or expected near-term customer value.

Presented by: Dean Abbott, President, Abbott Analytics
Thu, Oct 8,[masked]:00 PM – 2:00 PM EDT
Register here for this free webinar on Practical Customer Analytics using Predictive Approaches

Predictive approaches include considerable data cleaning and preparation, building predictive models, and assessing the predictive models. At each stage of the process, practical tips for accomplishing these tasks will be described with specific “how to’s”. We will also discuss compromises that inevitably need to be made because of data problems and time pressures to deploy solutions to operational systems.

Mr. Abbott has over 21 years of experience applying advanced data mining, data preparation, and data visualization methods in real-world data intensive problems, including fraud detection, risk modeling, text mining, response modeling, survey analysis, planned giving, and predictive toxicology. In addition, Mr. Abbott serves as chief technology officer and mentor for start-up companies focused on applying advanced analytics in their consulting practices.

Please reserve your seat today. Space is limited. The webinar will take place on Thursday, October 8th at 1:00pm EDT. We hope you can attend, but if you sign up and can’t make it we’ll send you a link to view the deck and recording the day after the webinar.

Free Registration Here.
results.name: Free Webinar: Practical Customer Analytics using Predictive Approaches

results.description:
Synthetic Biology: Science, Policy, and Ethics

Event link HERE. Free and open to the public. 


October 8th, 4pm

Harvard Law School, Casperson Student Center

Harkness South Dining Room (205)

:: :: ::

Synthetic biology, "which aims to apply standardized engineering techniques to biology and thereby create organisms or biological systems with novel or specialized functions to address countless needs” offers the potential for tremendous benefit, alongside a range of possible risks.  How should these benefits and risks be balanced, from a scientific, ethical, and policy perspective?  Please join us for a discussion of these issues with a leader in the field of synthetic biology and an expert in risk regulation and policy.

Panelists:

• George Church, Professor of Genetics, Harvard Medical School and Director, PersonalGenomes.org

• Adam Finkel, Senior Fellow and Executive Director, Penn Program on Regulation, University of Pennsylvania Law School and Clinical Professor of Environmental Health Sciences, University of Michigan School of Public Health
results.name: Synthetic Biology (?)

results.description:
If you haven't built anything with Meteor yet, it's pretty awesome. During this mini-hackathon, we'll see just how much you can get done in Meteor in a 4 hour sprint. I think you'll be shocked.

Here's are some of the high points of using Meteor:

- You write code in one language (JavaScript) on your front end and back end
- You share code directly between your client and server by convention
- You have access to an incredible package repository - things like forms, data tables, charts, pagination and more literally take one line of code and a few seconds to add to custom applications
- Actions which may interest clients are automatically pushed to them - without you needing to manually wire up any web sockets
- You get a much improved REPL for interactive programming (Even LISPers will be impressed)
- The programming model supports a focus on packages and reusability
- It's still based on Node and Javascript, so you can still use NPM and bower packages, and deploy anywhere you can run Node

How much can you get done in 4 hours? See you there. We'll have pizza, beer donations appreciated.

We're going to do this at my apartment. I'll announce the address to YES rsvps the day of the meetup.
results.name: MeteorJS Mini Hackathon

results.description:
Paul’s presentation will focus on agile marketing and its use in customer journey mapping.  Paul brings an interesting perspective to our group as QuickPivot is both a software company AND strategic marketing services company.  Paul helped to usher in agile software development at QuickPivot which took root and grew quickly into an asset, and those principles are in the early stages of adoption in the marketing services side of the business at QuickPivot.  That team historically relied on more traditional project management tools and processes and is modifying its approach and becoming agile.  Lessons learned, tools, tips will all filter through a discussion on how to quickly develop and refine customer journey maps as an agile organization.

Paul Mandeville is QuickPivot’s Chief Product Officer and leads their efforts in product strategy, innovation, and design.  Paul’s design and development work to date resulted in two QuickPivot patent filings and a 2014 MITX Award for best innovation in Marketing Automation Technology.  Prior to joining QuickPivot, Paul served as Chief Operating Officer and was part of the founding management team at Conversen, a Boston based cross channel marketing technology company that was acquired by Experian in 2012.  Paul also spends time on the advisory board of the Slater Technology Fund, an investment company focused on seed funding for innovative start-ups based in his home state of Rhode Island.  Husband, father, dog owner, cat owner, surfer, sailor Paul loves spending time with family, Narragansett Bay, shuffling around the field in an over 40 soccer league, and building things that people use and enjoy.


Location Sponsor DistrictHall
results.name: Focused Agile Journey Mapping for Fast Moving Customers

results.description:
How to Create a Leadership Career Plan
#WESTcareer
http://www.westorg.org/2015-10-08-a-leadership-career-plan

Can you confidently articulate your value to your company without hesitation? Are you positioning yourself to be visible and open to career advancement? Are you still waiting to be discovered? Most companies have strategic goals that guide them to greater profitability and productivity, but have you crafted your own strategic goals and multi-year career plan? How will you leverage your experience to propel your own growth and contribute to the development of your employer? This session will help you answer those questions and give you a blueprint for a sound career plan. 

This workshop will guide you to: 

• Examine your strengths, interests and preferences in planning your career 

• Prepare for opportunities before they present themselves

• Identify skills and competencies that need to be developed

• Be a magnet for the positions and goals you want

• Align your skills and talents with the organizational needs 

More about Karen

Karen Hinds began her career preparing promising interns to enter and build strong careers in financial services companies and since then she has been working with organizations to help build initiatives that mentor high-potential employees to career and leadership success. 

Known as the Emerging Leader Mentor, Karen is the Founder and CEO of Workplace Success Group, an international firm that has been referred to as a training ground for future business leaders. The company's signature program, Leadership Ready™, helps high-potential, emerging leaders to work more effectively with others, handle increasing levels of responsibilities, and take charge of their leadership growth. Karen is also the author of five business books. 

Date and Time:
October 8, 2015
6:00 - 8:30 PM


Agenda:

5:50-6:10pm: Registration, mingling, and light dinner
6:10-6:30pm: Facilitated networking
6:30-8:00pm: Workshop

Location: Regis College, 235 Wellesley Street, Fine Arts Center Atrium, Weston, MA 02493

Cost: Members: $35; Non-Members: $55, Workshop and Annual Membership: $120


Regis College Students and Faculty can attend for free

A light dinner will be served.

Interested in getting in shape but don’t know where to begin? Want to meet s

We have 2 groups:

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace.

results.description:
***This meetup is restricted to people who have attended at least one discussion of the Knapsack meetup group in the last six months. (Most of our meetups count.)***

Each session includes time to: connect with each other, silently reflect and write about our anti-racism work, report on how we're doing regarding our anti-racism work, and receive input and feedback.  We usually do the reporting and input/feedback in small groups of 3-4 people.  If you can't stay as late as 9:00, please go ahead and RSVP, just let us know your limitations.

Remember to bring your notebook, if you have one!  (We'll have a few extra for anyone who hasn't come to an accountability/support session before.)

We have two options for the accountability/support session each month, hoping that those who want to join us will be able to go to one or the other.  You are welcome to attend both sessions, if you would like to do so. 


For more about our thoughts on these sessions, see "Open discussion to consider monthly accountability sessions."  Note: even if you don't claim to be doing anti-racism work, you can come to the session and see what it is about, as well as consider your own role.  You still need to have met the requirement of having attended one of our discussion meetups within the last six months.


This is also a place where you can learn about and find an accountabilibuddy.

Accessibility Information: Pappenheim Library at Community Change, Inc. is wheelchair accessible with the following limitations.  The door to the building is heavy and does not have a button to open it. The elevator doors are slightly more than 30 inches wide.  The sixth floor bathrooms are not wheelchair accessible, but the first floor bathroom is.  During regular hours there are usually two tables in the library which limit mobility, but these are normally moved elsewhere during Knapsack events.  Please let us know your needs so we can help make the event accessible for you.
results.name: October Accountability and Support Session, Option 1 of 2

Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K.

Using CoolRunning.com’s Couch To 5K program we introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace.

• FREE 8-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles).

•  Anyone from the community can participate. 


• Led by experienced runners.

results.description:
Boston Clojure Group Meetups are held at Akamai in the conference rooms on the second floor (200C/D).

Please join us for a night of Clojure related discussion and group activities.

Meet & Greet starts at 6:00. Official group activities will begin at 6:30.


Agenda for this meeting:

4Clojure Night

https://www.4clojure.com is a great resource for Clojure practice.

At this meet up we will form into small groups, select a few interesting 4Clojure problems, and collaborate on passing the solution validation checks.

We can then do a show-and-tell about our solutions, and whether there were any other good solutions revealed from other contributors.


Stuck on a problem?  Ask the group for help!  I hope we'll have both beginners and experts. 4clojure problems span from trivial to very difficult.


We can also discuss workflows and tools that make the 4clojure process smoother.

Bonus:  Need a REST API?  Got 2 Minutes?? I'll demo creating a fully functioning REST API in Clojure, including online interactive API tests and documentation via Swagger - with just 3 shell commands and a well-known Clojure micro-framework. I was impressed when I discovered this, and thought I'd pass it along.

Future meeting ideas will be discussed over the meetup board and in our Google discussion group:  https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/boston-clojure .

results.description:
This month, with migration still in the news, I felt that it would be a good idea to talk about it. There are three large well-known migrations: from the Middle East and N. Africa to Europe, the Rohingya Migration out of Myanmar/Burma, and from Latin America to Anglo-America. Often times, though, in the case of conflicts, local countries are the recipients of the most migrants.

We'll discuss what the difference between a refugee and a migrant is, the legal rights of refugees in international law, and potential solutions and resiliencies that can better handle these crises.


After the discussion, we'll pop over to Grendel's Den for some food, drinks and meet-and-greet time. Hope to see you there, and I can't wait to meet everyone!

results.description:
Come join us for an informal conversation about how Insight might enhance your life. (Also offered on Oct 13th in Westwood) 

PGN members have asked Insight grads: 
- "What exactly is this Insight?" 
- "How is it different from other workshops?" 
- "Why is it three days?" 
- "What impact might Insight have on my life?" 
- "What if I have already done a whole lot of personal growth work?" 
- "Why should I take it now?"

A small, diverse panel of Insight graduates will share their experiences:  How they decided to take Insight; What were their experiences being in the room; What were the immediate changes from taking the workshop; What was the long-term value they received.  

Panelists include:
- Janet Parker, Insight facilitator and 
- Pam Haley, Senior Scientist at Instrumentation Laboratory
- Mark Hoffman, Engineer, MKS Instruments
- 

Why Should You Go?

The Insight I Seminar is scheduled for October 23-25, 2015 in Woburn.
- - > http://www.meetup.com/Personal-Growth-Network/events/220690183/

The Insight Teen Seminar is scheduled for February 18-21, 2016 in Dedham 
- - > http://www.meetup.com/Personal-Growth-Network/events/221875651/

These events are offered rarely.   The last Insight I was a year ago.  The last Insight Teen was over a decade ago.

 If you are at all interested in either of these workshops, consider attending this panel discussion to see if Insight might be right for you.

Note: This is the panel discussion for people close to the North metro area.  Another panel discussion is planned for people in the South metro area
- -  > http://www.meetup.com/Personal-Growth-Network/events/225703557/

A Bit About Insight
Insight is offered all around the World from Australia to South America to England to Bulgaria and the list goes on and on.   Insight has been offered in the Boston area, off and on, since 1979.  Occasional workshops returned to our region about three years ago after a decade-long absence.

Come join us and hear from local graduates their experience of Insight and how the seminar has touched their lives.

<a href="http://www.insightboston.org/"></a>
results.name: Insight:  What is Insight? (Informal panel discussion in MetroNorth.)

results.description:
What an exciting time to be alive, when the whole planet is undergoing a spiritual evolution/revolution. I HAVE JUST RETURNED FROM THE INSTITUTE OF NOETIC SCIENCES FIVE DAY CONFERENCE ON THE LATEST SCIENTIFIC DISCOVERIES SUPPORTING THAT SPIRIT/CONSCIOUSNESS IS PRIME IN THE UNIVERSE AND NOT MATTER, AND WE ARE IMMORTAL SOULS, AND I WILL SHARE THAT INFO IN MY PRESENTATION.
In addition I will give an introduction to my course, ‘Beggars At God’s Banquet: Miracles Are Our Birthright” My Course makes its unique contribution to this spiritual evolution in the following way: Creating Miracles Is A Three Step Process.
Step 1) In my 42 hour Course, I will show exactly how quantum physics came to the conclusion that "mind" is prime in the universe, and not matter, and, therefore, mind can transmute mater. I will then give the evidence showing how mind actually enters the cells of the body, even changing the DNA, and then we will see that applying quantum physics we will no longer see the body as a machine, but as an energy/information body operating as a messaging system. And I will show the scientific evidence that optimal health and miraculous recovery is possible when the quantum energy/information waves carrying the messages are not blocked, but are effectively transmitted.
Step 2) Yet, with all the scientific theory and evidence predicting miracles, we must ask why are physical healing miracles so rare. I will answer that question by showing the tricks our ego-mind (ie our usual mind) employs to keep us disempowered.
Step 3) Once we see the tricks of our ego-mind, we will see the need to go beyond our usual mind by giving our allegiance to spirit in order to be empowered. After we see our need for spirit, for the first time, we will have "new eyes to see" all the scientific evidence, and testimonials that are proof of spiritual power.
The combination of the scientific and testimonial evidence, and new eyes to see the evidence, because of a new allegiance to spirit, results in a "certainty" about the reality of spirit, that one will experience being spiritual power, and no longer just "trying" to get spiritual power. One will be in the blessed state of "the peace that passeth understanding," and the focused mind, which has proven to be the foundation for healing miracles.
Bio:
Barry Harris worked at the Hippocrates Institute in Boston, writing health booklets for Dr. Ann Wigmore, discoverer of wheatgrass and founder of the live food movement. Hippocrates Institute is a unique healing center with a powerful spiritual focus, and an extreme dietary regime which often attracted clients who Western medicine had labeled terminally ill. While there Barry witnessed many miraculous recoveries. Later Barry witnessed more miracles while working for four years in various centers around the U.S. founded by Viktoras Kulvinskas, Dr. Wigmore's Director. Obsessed with the secret to miracles, Barry did 20 years of independent research connecting quantum physics (ie his college major) to Energy Medicine, cellular biology, mind/body medicine, effect of emotions on health, etc.
Barry's research has been the source for the course "Beggars At God's Banquet: Miracles Are Our Birthright" which he has been presenting for the past nine years. Barry's book "Beggars At God's Banquet" based on the contents of the course will be published by X-Libris Publishing this fall or early winter.
Barry is also a singer/voice teacher who teaches "Voice as a Path of Spiritual and Emotional Healing. His voice students learn the relationship of ego to breath patterns, and how to surrender control to a higher power, which are insights he uses in his miracles course.. Barry is qualified to teach about miracles, because he had his own miracle. He restored his singing voice by recognizing the need for spiritual grace and surrender of control to a higher power, after Western doctors said he had damaged his voice beyond repair.

results.description:
The 2015 Draconid meteor shower is expected to peak on October 9. A new Moon on October 13, 2015 will create ideal conditions for those in the Northern Hemisphere to view the meteors. [NOTE: they mean overnight into the morning of October 9th]

Two meteor showers in October

The Draconid meteor shower, also sometimes known as the Giacobinids, is one of the two meteor showers to annually grace the skies in October. The Draconids owe their name to the constellation Draco the Dragon, and are created when the Earth passes through the dust debris left by comet 21 P/ Giacobini-Zinner. The comet takes about 6.6 years to make a single revolution around the Sun.

Although the Draconids have been responsible for some of the most spectacular meteor showers in recorded history, most recently in 2011, most astronomers and sky gazers consider these to be one of the least interesting meteor showers in during the year.

The Orionids are the second meteor shower in October. It usually peaks around October 21.
Location in the sky

The Draconids meteor shower is not visible at this time of year. The best date is around Oct 8, 2015, table below is for that date: [see website]

Much more on the site, the link is under 'Source(s)' below.

Source(s):
http://www.timeanddate.com/astronomy/meteor-shower/draconid.html
results.name: 2015 Draconid Meteor Shower

results.description:
Itadaki downstairs bar (Boston, Newbury St. between Gloucester and Fairfield) 7 pm to 10 pm

Join me at this izakaya style venue for a pleasant evening of drinks, food and chats. Whether you're learning Japanese or English, buy a drink, join the table, and practice your new language in a friendly and relaxed environment. If you're a beginner or just interested in culture, you'll fit in fine! Don't miss out on this opportunity to learn and practice over a few drinks. Can't make it on time? Need to leave early? Not a problem. Just stop by if you can!

If you are >21 and plan to drink, please bring a MA state issued ID or passport. Other state IDs may not be accepted. Please order at the bar and take care of your own tab.

Transportation: I highly recommend using public transportation. Not only is driving while intoxicated dangerous, but there may not be any parking available in the area. A lot of the parking on Newbury St  is Residential Only in the evenings, and many of the signs indicating this are very well hidden. If you insist on parking in the area, be aware that meter maids love handing out parking tickets around here. Best methods for public transportation are the green line subway or bus #1 to the Hynes stop.

I have made an arrangements with the Itadaki staff for a simpler ordering method. Last time was very chaotic and stressful for the bartender, so lets do our best to not confuse the bartender. :)

Ordering at Itadaki

1) Order your first drink at the bar. If it's alcoholic, your ID will be checked at this time. You will also be  given a guest number to use the rest of the night.

2) If you're at a table, the bartender will try to make several rounds throughout the night to take additional orders. Keep using your guest number and please feel free to order more food and drinks.

3) Keep in mind we're a pretty large group so don't be offended or annoyed with the bartender if he doesn't get to you right away. If you have an urgent order, go request it at the bar.

4) Please take care of your tab and don't forget to tip*. The management and staff are doing a lot to make this all possible.

*Note: If the group is large, an 18% tip may already be included.

See you there!
~Lindsay
results.how_to_find_us: Go to the downstairs bar and look for the sign!
results.name: Backbay Japanese Evening Table

results.description:
"A universal theology is impossible, but a universal experience is not only possible but necessary. It is this experience toward which the course is directed." (ACIM Manual for Teachers)

Designed to correct perception and lead to a universal experience of knowledge, A Course In Miracles has been translated into 23 languages, is referenced and utilized by many of today's most reknowned spiritual teachers, and has inspired countless books and curriculums based on its teachings. But it can be a difficult book to grasp. It is lengthy, the writing is abstract, and its use of Christian terminology alienates many.

And yet it has become one of the most influential spiritual books of today. Join us as we dive into it, and are led to understand its principles against the backdrop of our own personal experiences and insights. Beginner as well as advanced Course students are welcome. We'll start with a short meditation, and then use a reading from the Course as an entry point into our time together. Cost $5 per person.

Bringing a copy of the book is helpful, but not necessary. Recommended (but again not necessary) is the combined volume that includes the three supplements (Clarification of Terms; Psychotherapy: Purpose, Process, and Practice; The Song of Prayer), available online from The Foundation For Inner Peace at acim.org.

results.description:
[Update] We’re pushing the event date back a few weeks, due to the Jewish High Holidays, and Matt being at Hashiconf. Oct. 8 is the new inaugural date.

Hubots are those chat bots that post cat pictures or give you constant updates about your repos. Did you ever wonder how they do that, maybe you want to write one yourself to do something.

For this meetup Yieldbot's Matt Jones will demonstrate how to setup a hubot in a free Slack channel using Heroku's free tier and then show some of the things you can do with it, using basic Javascript, to make your lives easier. This will be done in a start to finish manner and the code and slides will be made available after the meetup for those that wish to deploy or hack on it further. There will also be plenty of time to talk about ChatOps in general or any other infrastructure coding topics such as Configuration Management, Source Control, and Monitoring.

Additional presentation proposals are always welcome. The topic guideline is simply infrastructure coding. Preference will be given to Open Source products or integrations of several products such as using Vagrant and Chef to build a development environment.
results.name: What are Hubots?  Come find out, write one, and make your lives easier.

results.description:
How Do we open up our hearts to find Joy in our life?
Life hits us with obstacles and challenges that keep us from readily accessing Joy.
Do you feel stuck in your life? We get stuck in thought patterns and behaviors in our life that prevent us from creating the life of our dreams. To move forward we must re-purpose what is holding us back and develop new ways to approach life by redefining our underlying beliefs.This is deeply transformational work that will elevate your personal experience of life, enabling you to have deeper relationships that work, the ability to go with the flow and experience great Joy.

In this series of workshops in a supportive group setting you will explore feelings, aspects of ourselves and ways to balance that control our ability to experience more Joy. Each workshop we will work with our own personal healing through the use of visualization and high vibrational essential oils to help us move through our personal growth.

results.description:
Plan to attend this Bible-based workshop on the topic "By His Stripes We Were Healed." We as Christians readily acknowledge that Jesus Christ was the sacrifice for our sins. Do we also realize that he was the sacrifice for our sickness too? Through his selfless sacrifice, we may claim freedom from sin and sickness. Health is part of the more abundant life Jesus Christ came to make available (John 10:10). And our good health is at the top of God's wish list, as stated in III John 2:

Beloved, I wish above all things that thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.


Come on out and be a part of this workshop...it will add prosperity to your soul so that you can claim the health God so desires for you.

This event will be held at the new Panera Bread in Westwood, located at 201 University Ave, in the new University Station shopping mall. Start time is 7:00 p.m.

results.description:
ABOUT THE WORKSHOP: Now in its 14th year, the weekly Boston Poetry workshop (formerly “Charles River Writers”) has always been an open forum for literary fellowship and discussion.

To participate, please RSVP here, and arrive bearing enough copies of the text you’d like to discuss – whether prose or verse – for each participant to have their own. If you do not have the means to make copies of your writing, send the text by attachment to bostonpoetryunion (at) gmail (dot) com not later than the night before the workshop.

Occasionally, the moderator will invite a member or guest speaker to open the session with a brief talk on some literary topic. If you’re interested in delivering such a talk, email the organizers and let them know! Likewise let us know if you’d like to suggest a writing exercise or event.

Persons of every level of experience as writers are welcome.

results.description:
The presence of the Angelic Realm is among us all, in every moment.

They are here to support us, to guide us, to heal us while we are here on this physical plane.

Many experience signs from the angels - feathers, pennies, 444 (triple or reoccurring numbers), a song on the radio at just the right moment, a call from someone you we just thinking about are just a few.

We must remember as part of our choice to be here now, we were given divine free will in every moment to decide our next step, our thoughts, and our actions (and re-actions) in regards to our life.  Your angels want for you to call on them, to talk to them, to ask for their support and guidance - and then and only then can they attend to you and your life.

During this group we will call upon the Angelic Realm to support us and guide us through the process of relaxing, clearing all that no longer serves and healing on al levels.

This will open you to a new, higher vibration and energies as you will then be able to 'hold' more light.  You will be in direct communion with your Angelic Support Team and ask for any specific guidance or questions that you may have.

Only high frequency loving energies will be called upon, so you will be safe and protected within this sacred space.

This is a great way to connect with your personal angelic support team, re-connect with your guardian angels or simply experience the loving and supportive energies of the angels!

Also a great space to connect with other spiritually minded individuals!

Energy Exchange $10

Nicol will be leading this group.

www.essencehealing.net to learn more about Essence of Healing
results.name: Angelic Healing - Connect to Your Angels!

results.description:
Our guest photographer for this workshop will be Ron Ranere.  Ron has been in the Boston fashion photography circuit for some time, and is owner of Positive Image Photography.  Ron is completing his new studio after closing his longstanding studio in Boston.  What Ron will be talking to us about is something really fantastic..."Liquid Light"  A fantastic addition to artistic photography and to get a glimpse of it please use this link:  http://www.positiveimage-boston.com/liquid-light.html

He describes it as: "Models moving draped with light, choreographed to capture the flow of color. The image comes up on the monitor in an otherwise dark studio. It's an amazing experience seeing the outcome, it moves photography into a whole new level of art."

I think you will agree it is a pretty exciting form of photography worthy of an "artistic" notation.

IMAGE COPYRIGHT: Ron Ranere 

You may attend this workshop as a guest and meet the members of RiversEdge .   I think you will find us a friendly group of adventurous photographers who specialize in portraiture in all its forms.  We meet at Studio Imaging 637, our home location, for our photo sessions and workshops.   

Hope to see you there!
results.name: LIQUID LIGHT WORKSHOP with RON RANERE

results.description:
Ongoing class in Medieval and Renaissance Longsword in the tradition of Johannes Lichtenauer.


The Longsword is the iconic fantasy Knight's sword - a two-handed, straight blade with a cross guard. The weapon may seem to be simple at first but is in reality a weapon of finesse and skill.


The class covers all the basics of footwork, attacks and defenses. Drills are developed from simple to complex; from rigidly choreographed to open-ended. Timing, distance and judgement are developed.


All classes begin with a Strength & Conditioning program designed to physically prepare one for fighting with the sword. Elements develop agility, core stability and power.

results.description:
Get tix now! https://www.eventbrite.com/e/sketchhaus-tickets-16995428785

Sad that you can't find Cadbury S'cream Eggs anywhere? So are we. Let's soothe our sadness with ImprovBoston SketchHaus. It's the last show before the sold-out Disney show next week and GOREFEST the following two weeks! 

First up: It's Boston's best rovng storytelling show, Wild Memory Nation! This hilariously revealing show has peddled its wickedly funny self at the Boston Comedy Arts Festival, The Women In Comedy Festival, Johnny D's Comedy Presents, and all over ImprovBoston. Tonight's theme is "We Used To Be Friends," and you're getting stories from this stacked roster: Tooky Kavanagh, Kenice Mobley, Brett Johnson, and Emily Ruskowski! True stories, real funny!


THEN YOUR HEADLINER: Sketchhaus Producer Kevin Quigley has been directing sketch group World of Hurt for like five years, and they've only gotten weirder with each performance. We just featured at the Best of Boston Sketch. We headlined there! You wanna know what to do with a bus baby? You have no idea what a tuna bush is? What's up with bears? See the show! With birthday boy Dan Strom, April Singley, Amanda L. Hurley, Jack German, Jonathan Hislop, Bryan Smith, and effervescent delight Ciarán Grumley.

PLUS: your host for the evening is all-around great and funny Bryce Hanson! With special guest star Chris Post! We might give you candy! (By law we can't give you candy.) An absolutely packed night of comedy, and it's all for you!
results.name: ImprovBoston Sketchhaus Presents: World of Hurt & Wild Memory Nation!

results.description:
11 years of Thursday night dance parties. No bottles, no visuals... Just dark dancing. That's 2,750 hours of non-stop electronic dance music.

For the celebration of our 11 years as a club night, we're bringing back one of our favorite guests of all-time: the boys of BICEP. We love these guys because they came first from a rabid love of music and backed into becoming artists. First as a deep dive blog that has been running for, well, a long time, they devoted themselves to lost or under-appreciated genres like Italo, Boogie and Disco. Yet it was their destiny to become stars.

Friends as teenagers, they would slip into raves and at the age of 16 had already witnessed the genius of Tiga, the phenomenal UNDERGROUND RESISTANCE and Philadelphia's Josh Wink.

Fast-forward and they're now releasing on labels like Fink and Will Saul Artist Page's Aus Music and collaborating with Simian Mobile Disco. The big time, basically.

Welcome back boys.

11 YEARS OF MAKE IT NEW W/ BICEP
And the Make It New Resident DJs Thu October 8th, 2015
Middlesex Lounge
315 Massachusetts Ave.
Cambridge, MA
Central Square Cultural District

Limited Advance tickets to come

Stay on top of the news:
http://twitter.com/mmmmaven
results.name: Make It New with Bicep (11 Year Anniversary Party)

(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>)


The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the essential life energy within.

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru

results.description:
Leedz Edutainment Presents:
KRS-One "Now Hear This " Tour

18+

$20 Advance...buy tickets online here, http://m.ticketweb.com/t3/sale/SaleEventDetail?dispatch=loadSelectionData&eventId=6129685&pl=mideastreastaurant&REFID=elink

$25 Day of Show 9:00 pm doors

KRS-One, an acronym for “Knowledge Reigns Supreme Over Nearly Everyone”, has been called the “conscience of Hip Hop” (Rolling Stone), “the greatest live emcee ever” (The Source), the “spokesperson for Hip Hop” (Wall Street Journal), “master teacher” (Zulu Nation) and the “son of Hip Hop” (Kool DJ Herc). With 20 published albums to his credit and his numerous appearances with other artists, KRS-One has literally written the most rhymes in Hip Hop’s history. In the 1990s as “hip-hop” grew more and more commercialized and corporate, it was KRS-One who openly rejected such cultural exploitation and grounded Hip Hop in its original principles of peace, love, unity and safely having fun. Teaching everything from self-creation to stopping violence; from vegetarianism to transcendental meditation, from the establishment of Hip Hop Appreciation Week (every third week in May), to establishing Hip Hop as an international culture at the United Nations (2001), KRS-One has single-handedly held the history and original arts of Hip Hop together now for over two decades.

Public Transit:

Red Line subway to Central Square Station

or

#1 Mass Ave bus to Central Square

Directions:

Check out Google to arrange your driving directions.

Parking:

There are plenty of nearby metered parking spots in Municipal lots as well as the cheap ($3/hour) Green Street Garage.
results.name: KRS-One, "Now Hear This" Tour

results.description:
REGISTRATION LINK: http://2015naaapnlc.eventbrite.com

2015 Conference Theme: “Agility: Creating Your Path to Success”
The NAAAP Northeast Leadership Conference (NLC) is a unique, one-day conference that employers and talent managers can leverage to engage and develop their diverse professional staff and ERGs (Employee Resource Groups).
The NLC is a flagship event for the Northeast Chapters of National Association of Asian American Professionals (NAAAP). This year’s conference will be held in Boston, MA on October 9, 2015.
Asian American professionals and students from diverse industries and functions will gather from across the Northeast region of the US to network, learn and grow professionally. High-profile Asian executives will teach and inspire attendees during keynote addresses, workshops and panel discussions. 

Conference Summary
With today’s dynamic, fast-paced, and uncertain business environments, individuals, teams and organizations need to learn how to be agile and work nimbly to stay relevant. Companies that were once household names and dominated their industries, like Eastman Kodak and Motorola, are struggling to survive as they have failed to adapt to change. Others, like Amazon, Google and Apple, continue to reinvent themselves to stay ahead of evolving industry and customer demands. The willingness and capability to be agile and adapt to change has become one of the most critical success factors for managers and executives.
NAAAP Boston recognizes that agility has become an essential competency. Individuals and organizations must anticipate and work with change to capitalize on the opportunities it brings. The 2nd Annual Northeast Leadership Conference (NLC) hosted by NAAAP Boston will focus on the theme of “Agility” by providing individuals and organizations with the practical skills and actionable techniques to anticipate and adjust to the next challenge.
results.name: 2nd Annual NAAAP Northeast Leadership Conference

group.name: NAAAP Boston - Natl Assoc of Asian American Professionals

results.description:
An awesome annual 3-day free festival bringing brass bands from all over the United States and the world to Somerville for a celebration of music, community and activism.

Organized entirely by volunteers and now in its 10th year, the festival kicks off on Friday night with a lantern parade in Davis Square neighborhoods and a band showcase at Johnny D’s. On Saturday more than 25 bands take over Davis Square for a giant music and dance party. On Sunday, local community groups, artists, and activists working for a variety of progressive causes — economic justice, protecting the environment, world peace, an end to racism — join the brass bands to make a spectacular parade from Davis Square to Harvard Square along Mass Avenue.

More details & schedule: http://honkfest.org/2015-festival/schedule-2015
results.name: HONK! Festival of Activist Street Bands

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball.

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Friday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

results.description:
This walk is on a paved path through the woods. This path is stroller friendly or you could carry your child. It is a little hilly, but appropriate for most fitness levels. We alternate walks between the inner and outer loops which are both under 3 miles. It usually takes less than an hour. We walk past a playground too, so we could stop and play there for a while. Afterwards, we sit at the picnic tables under the trees by the visitor center and feed our babies, chat, etc. 

We will meet outside the visitor center in the upper parking lot on the Saugus side of the park, past the Kasabuski Skating Rink.  There are bathrooms with a changing table in the visitor center too.

Running late?  No prob. You can always meet up with us at the picnic tables next to the visitor center after we finish the walk. 

***By popular demand this is set as weekly event.  If the weather is bad we can change it to a different day or skip the week.

results.description:
ULTIMATE ENERGETIC ENTREPRENEURAPALOOZA

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3gLWSpP5vLI

Running your own business is a personal growth machine. Business is not only happening outside of you, much of it happens inside of you. To be successful you must master both the inner and outer aspects.

* Gain clarity on your business goals
* Discover your Life Purpose Profile
* Identify your revenue streams
* Energy work AND business development
* This is NOT a pitch-fest!

Many spiritual business people don't like to look at their numbers, while many traditional business people don't consider the spiritual or energetic side of business at all. For true success you need both and that is what this weekend is all about.

FAST ACTION PRICING END SEP 9th

See http://navitascoach.com/uee for more information and to register

MORE ABOUT UEE
Your hosts for this three-day event, Leigh Daniel, Andy Grant & Lori Grant, bring their lifetimes of business experience, training and life lessons together for the first time ever. We can guarantee you've never been to an event like this, because this combination of people, experience, and knowledge has never come together before!

•  You will develop a six-figure (or more!) business plan for your business
• You will do the inner work to clear the way for your plans to become your reality
• You will explore your Life Purpose Profile and see how it impacts your life and business

This is an immersive experience and intimate gathering to allow the great impact, both individually and for the group.

WHAT CAN I EXPECT?
Our best advice is for you to be open to the unexpected. This is an experiential workshop combining energy work and business development. You gain new skills and tools that can enhance all aspects of you, your life and your business.

•  Allow yourself to go beyond your comfort zone
• Be fully engaged and willing to take risks
• This will be a safe and supportive environment for your growth and exploration

If you come with an open heart and an open mind, you will be well rewarded. You'll be rewarded with growth, insight, clarity, new tools, new friends and more. All surrounded by a gorgeous Fall in New England. Perhaps you'll take advantage of the 38 acres, trails, Lake Cochichewick, and labyrinths available to you at Rolling Ridge Retreat Center.

See http://navitascoach.com/uee for more information and to register

FAST ACTION PRICING END SEP 9th

GUEST SPEAKERS
Brad "Little Frog" Hudson is a shamanic healer and teacher, multidimensional energy healer, and best selling author. Brad will lead us on an experience to show how to use Spirit to start and grow your business. Learn more about Brad at LittleFrogHealing.com

Phillipa Kiripatea is a marketing coach for entrepreneurs who love to dream big. She inspires and motivates entrepreneurs to dream bigger and to make their big dreams a reality. Phillipa joins us all the way from Australia! Learn more at PhillipaKiripatea.com

Navigating the world of online systems can be overwhelming. Sally Hendrick is a master of online tools, especially utilizing free programs to build your business. There are so many cool systems you can use to make your business administration easier. Let Sally show you the way!


Dena Gould is an intuitive healer, psychic and medium. As an expert in helping people embrace their authentic self, she will lead us through a number of processes with EFT (Emotional Freedom Technique) to clear our old stories and embrace our inner light.

Leigh Daniel is a practicing attorney, international speaker and founder of Project Positive Change. Leigh is a world class networker and long-time successful small business owner. She'll be sharing her experiences and insight regarding personal growth and business growth.

Gary Keil, PhD, is an expert on the intimate connections between the mind and body. He has a passion for fusing science and teaching, and is dedicated to helping people create greater mental and physical resiliency to succeed in business and life.

See http://navitascoach.com/uee for more information and to register

Remember being a kid and going off to summer camp? You left a little nervous but always ended up with a new best friend or two. Have you allowed yourself an experience like that as an adult? How about for you business? This is your opportunity.

The Ultimate Energetic Entrepreneurapalooza (UEE) brings together entrepreneurs and business people from all walks of life in an immersive, supportive environment.

•  Get clarity of business goals and plans!
• Do the inner work most are missing!
• Connect with an amazing group of people!

UEE runs from dinner Friday straight through to Sunday at 4pm. All meals and lodging are included in your investment. There are multiple bedrooms with twin beds and shared restrooms and showers in the hall. We will walk to the dining hall in the main house.

The weekend will be full of experiential work on the inner and outer game of your business.

Please note that Rolling Ridge is a refurbished private residence and is not a traditional hotel. The only beds available are twin beds and all bedrooms are shared. The men's and women's restrooms and showers are shared as well. This may seem like "roughing it" to you. Think of it as entrepreneur boot camp!

See http://navitascoach.com/uee for more information and to register
results.name: UEE: Ultimate Energetic Entrepreneurapalooz­a

results.description:
#Tech4Democracy Showcase and Challenge: Using digital technology to improve local governance. Interested members of the general public can either simply register to attend this event or submit a proposal to present their own idea. 

Event link HERE. ~ RSVP to attend HERE. ~ Submit your proposal HERE.

:: :: ::


Friday, October 9, 2015, 5-7pm

John F. Kennedy Jr. Forum, Harvard Kennedy School

79 John F. Kennedy St. Cambridge

:: :: ::

About the Event: Greater Boston is home to a growing and vibrant community of civic technologists: students, entrepreneurs, and passionate citizens who are using their creativity and knowledge of digital technology to make our governments run better, engage our communities, and improve our quality of life.

 The #Tech4Democracy Showcase and Challenge will bring together the local civic tech community and anyone with an interest in learning more about civic tech--from those curious about how these technologies can benefit them to public officials looking to bring new technology to their work. Check out dozens of civic tech demonstrations, prototypes, and displays from students, civic tech startups, entrepreneurs, and others. Presenters will share their ideas for new apps, platforms, policies, or programs that leverage technology to improve the quality of democratic governance.

No matter your background, the #Tech4Democracy Showcase and Challenge is an opportunity to share ideas, join in conversation, or simply browse. There will be music, good food, beer, wine, and other refreshments.

This is a free event but registration is recommended as space is limited Click at link above to RSVP.

The “showcase” will feature students and alumni from Harvard University and other area universities, as well as civic tech startups, entrepreneurs and passionate citizens from across the Greater Boston area. Each presenter will demonstrate their idea through posters, prototypes, and other creative demonstrations.

The “challenge” will feature an esteemed panel of experts and leaders in the local civic tech movement to select the best idea/demonstration. In addition, everyone will be invited to vote for their favorite idea.

To apply to demonstrate your civic tech idea and compete for an award click on the link above.

The Ash Center for Democratic Governance and Innovation is excited to host the #Tech4Democracy Showcase and Challenge as part of HUBweek—a unique series of events, unexpected experiences, and celebrations of the world-changing work, art, and thinking being imagined and built in Greater Boston. Harvard Kennedy School is hosting a number of timely public discussions during HUBweek on the future of U.S. cities, wage equity, and social innovation. Find more information on HUBweek, including a calendar of these and other events, at hubweek.org.

:: :: ::

The #Tech4Democracy Showcase and Challenge is being organized with support from:

• The Shorenstein Center on Media, Politics and Public Policy, Harvard Kennedy School

• The City of Somerville

• The City of Boston

• The City of Cambridge Budget Office

• The Edward M. Kennedy Institute for the United States Senate

• FWD.us

• Boston Civic Media Consortium

• The Engagement Lab, Emerson College
results.name: #Tech4Democracy Showcase

Dear Boston Culture Lovers,

The Pumpkin Spice and Everything Nice is one the ICA AFTER 5 Friday series of  special tastings, artisan demonstrations, DIY workshops Friday night events at their Water Café.  This event will feature fall beer tastings and bites. Can you think of a better way to welcome in the Fall?


Admission to this event is  included with the price of regular museum admission.  ($15 general public/ $10 students/ FREE for ICA Members).  

This event is scheduled from 5 to 8 pm, however the meeting time for the Meet-up group is set for 5:30 pm at the ticket counter.  Promptly at 5:30pm, we can go into the Water Cafe as a group to enjoy the event.  


This is certainly a public event and you are able to attend this enjoy regardless if you belong to this Meet-Up group.  Events are successful and carefree when I know who and how many people to expect.   I only ask that you only reserve "YES" if you are definitely attending and intend to meet members of the group. If you reserve "YES" and then have a change of plans, no problem, please update the attendance reservation.

A consistent history of not showing up for events may cause you to be removed from the group. 


I look forward in enjoying this event with the group.


Joana

Learn 5 Essential Planning Strategies for Financial Freedom

Everyone has different financial objectives. Whether it is to save for a secure comfortable retirement, pay for your child’s college education, buy a house, take a vacation, make sure your bills are paid on time, or get out of debt, this workshop will help you accomplish your goals.  

Learn strategies and basic principles that will help you achieve your financial goals. Financial literacy will improve your money management skills. If you would like to: 

• Learn the fundamentals of investing

• Identify challenges that are blocking opportunities to a higher net worth

• Increase your awareness on spending & how to save money

• Learn the Do’s & Don’ts to a secure financial future

• Get your questions answered & share what empowers you to get motivated

Beth Hughes has been an Independent Financial Planner for 10 years. Prior to working in finance she was an RN for 18 years. Her passion for educating people on financial literacy is evident in all her workshops. The goal is for everyone to experience a fun, educational, interactive evening.

Beverages & light food offered.

results.description:
This fall, GlobeMed at MIT will be hosting its 2nd annual charity gala to benefit our partner, Hope Through Health (HTH). HTH is a nonprofit organization that runs five HIV health clinics in northern Togo, West Africa. Like all of our fundraisers, 100% of the proceeds from the event will be donated directly to Hope Through Health.

Tickets are on sale now at tickets.mit.edu. Dinner by Sara Eller's Catering and beverages by Polar will be provided. A cash bar will be available at the event. Cocktail attire is recommended. Paid parking will also be available at the NERD Center. A valid government-issued ID is required for entrance into the NERD Center.

The gala will feature presentations by leaders in global health and poverty. These include Sam Daley-Harris, CEO of the Center for Citizen Empowerment and Transformation and founder of RESULTS, and Dr. Anita Shankar, medical anthropologist and public health researcher at the Johns Hopkins University, Bloomberg School of Public Health.

For more information about GlobeMed and the event, visit us online at globemed.mit.edu. To learn more about Hope Through Health, visit hthglobal.org. For other event-related questions, contact [masked] or [masked].
results.name: GlobeMed at MIT Gala for Hope

results.description:
This fall, GlobeMed at MIT will be hosting its 2nd annual charity gala to benefit our partner, Hope Through Health (HTH). HTH is a nonprofit organization that runs five HIV health clinics in northern Togo, West Africa. Like all of our fundraisers, 100% of the proceeds from the event will be donated directly to Hope Through Health. See who is going

https://www.facebook.com/events/871378942916553/


Tickets are on sale now at tickets.mit.edu. Dinner by Sara Eller's Catering and beverages by Polar will be provided. A cash bar will be available at the event. Cocktail attire is recommended. There is plenty of street parking. A valid government-issued ID is required for entrance into the NERD Center.

The gala will feature presentations by leaders in global health and poverty. These include Sam Daley-Harris, CEO of the Center for Citizen Empowerment and Transformation and founder of RESULTS, and Dr. Anita Shankar, medical anthropologist and public health researcher at the Johns Hopkins University, Bloomberg School of Public Health.
results.name: GlobeMed at MIT Gala for Hope

<em style="font-size : 16px">Although this event takes place every Friday, I am only scheduling the Meetup once a month, on the 2nd Friday. Please note that the actual wine tasting runs from 5pm to 8pm, but we will meet at 6pm!


Gary

A message from The Wine Bottega:

Join us for our weekly Friday night tasting. It's always something delicious, educational and interesting. You can sign up for our weekly e-mail to get the details! (See the bottom of the homepage)

A NOTE FROM THE ORGANIZER:

Okay... We all love free stuff. That's why we're members of this group! So I'm going to post this as a recurring weekly event, as long as people are enjoying it. This event runs from 5pm till 8pm, but you can go for as much or as little time as you want. Please use the message area below to post if you're looking for people to join you. There are many restaurants in the North End, too, so feel free to post dinner requests, too. Let's make this page a collaborative web site!

Happy Free Tasting!

Gary

PS - If you like wine tastings, don't forget to check out the Central Bottle events, as well!

PPS - Please note that I have automatic reminders for this event turned off, since it is a repeating event.

From the restaurant website:

From the moment you step foot through our doors, you'll be transported to a unique Bonefish Grill experience. Prepare for the unexpected – a journey that will ignite your taste buds, reward your curiosity and turn any visit into so much more than your typical night out.

The Interior / The Atmosphere

With a mix of big city vibe and a touch of nature, our vibrant, comfortable, and conversational atmosphere is the perfect backdrop for any occasion. As you head into the dining room you'll notice detailed designs complete with bonefish sculptures shimmering through the mirrors and glimmering in our fabrics and art. Settle into a different kind of dining, Bonefish Grill style.

The Service

Whether you're looking for chef-coat service or a more laid back approach - you're in good hands at Bonefish Grill. We take fine dining and remove all the stuffiness that gets in the way, creating excitment as our fresh food experts guide you through your culinary experience. Prepare those forks!

Please be courteous to our fellow meetup members. RSVP only if you're absolutely going to attend. Late cancels/No Shows negatively impact the group experience.

No Shows/cancels within 48 hrs will be removed from the group.
results.how_to_find_us: Reservations will be under Judy

results.description:
We've had a taste of Thailand and Tibet recently.  Now we're going a little further West.  


Rani's chicken tikka masala has Yelpers handing out five stars like candy on Halloween and I personally order the biryani (a monster rice-and-chicken dish) on a weekly basis as my cheat meal.

The restaurant also happens to boast classy interiors and a full bar.  Booze and Indian food go hand-in-hand.  Hangovers and Indian food also go hand-in-hand, just in case you prefer beer to paneer.

It doesn't get better than that.  So join us at this wildly popular and centrally located joint near bustling Coolidge Corner!
results.name: Let's Get Some Indian Food!

results.description:
Have you been interested in attending a Boston Blind Wine Tasting event but would like to have some basic education before diving in?  Want to learn more about how to understand and think about wine?  This event will cover some very basic concepts for those people who want to begin to explore wines and all their interesting characteristics.  There will be 8 wines to taste with the guidance of two knowledgeable people – one with “old world” expertise (Michael) and the other with much knowledge about “new world” wines (Eric).  You’ll learn some basics about how wines are labeled/named and how to describe what you like.  You’ll have a chance to compare and contrast wines from the same varietal and understand concepts like:  mineral, fruit forward, oaky, delicate, structured and tannic.  Light, complementary (and complimentary!) appetizers will be provided.

Cost for this event is $25.  Pay through PayPal to [masked]. Please choose the "Send Money to Friends or Family" option, otherwise Paypal will collect a fee. If you don’t have a PayPal account it is very quick and easy to set one up with your credit card.  If you register without paying you will be moved to the wait list until your PayPal payment is received. 

Bring:  3 wine stems if you have them – if not, we have plenty to share.  An address for the event will be sent to you by email shortly before the event, so make sure your email settings allow you to receive emails from this group.

*Let Jill know through meetup messaging if you would be interested in a Wine 201 for those people who have been attending BBWT events but want a primer on basic concepts
results.name: Wine 101

results.description:
Chakradance

Dance with us from 7:45 pm - midnight at The First Parish Cambridge Unitarian Universalist Church at 3 Church St., Cambridge, MA.

The fabulous, fun-filled event begins with a class from 7:45 to 9:15 and continues with dj'd dancing until  11:30pm music provided by some extraordinary DJs. 

Dancers of all ages and abilities are invited to dance barefoot, any way you like, with or without a partner, in a smoke and alcohol free environment. Children are welcome.

[masked]  Christabeth leads Chakradance

Chakradance™ is a sweet dance with the soul. It's an inward journey where you meet your self exactly where you are, and illuminate your 7 major chakras (energy centers). Each chakra is key holder to different parts of yourself and your life, and may be holding old patterns that no longer serve you.

Christabeth Ingold is a fierce, sparked up certified life coach, Reiki practitioner and Chakradance™ facilitator. She has a background in expressive therapy, wellness and life coaching, Reiki and loving big. You may find her giving hugs, laughing, dancing


After Chakradance™ enjoy dancing to music by DJ Mystical Michael:

DJ Mystical Michael has been a DJ for more than thirty years, beginning with turntables, then moving to CDs and now digital on his MacBook. He plays a global and eclectic mix of rhythms and tempos to provide opportunities for creative and fun movement including American Pop, R&B, Rock, Dance, EDM and orchestral music. Michael has been a Reiki Teaching Master and Counselor for more than twenty years.
He is Director of Providence Zen Center in addition to a Life Coaching and Reiki Counseling private practice.

Dance Friday is an activity of the non-profit Movement Collective. Suggested Donation: $15 8pm-9:15, $10-15 after 9:30, $5-10 after 11,  under  23 years old $5-15, or donate 45 minutes of your time to help out.  We recommend casual, light-weight, comfortable clothing that you can  move in.

We are a all Volunteer run event, we welcome  your participation in putting on this event each week. 

For more information, please call: 6I[masked], go to <a>www.dancefriday.org,</a> or visit us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/#/pages/Dance-Friday/[masked]?ref=ts

results.description:
Here's the game plan:

8:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

8:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

8:20 - Play!!!!!!

10:00 - Conclude the meetup and begin socializing.

Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white and a dark-colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a light or dark "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!

results.description:
BIDA welcomes you back for another Spark in the Dark alternative contra, on friday October 9th, from 8-11 pm.

Our music for the night will be the sick beats of Ed Howe and Julie Vallimont with the inimitable Steve Zakon-Anderson calling. We are excited to be back at the Cambridge Community Center at:
5 Callender St, Cambridge, MA 02139. **** Please note the different TIME and LOCATION! We don't want anyone getting lost! ******** This is a special contra dance with live electronic-acoustic music and special club lighting. As always, BIDA is an inclusive community and everyone is welcome. And if you bring a friend who's new to BIDA, you'll both get free passes to a future dance! The Cambridge Community Center is just a few blocks from Central Square on the Red Line, and has limited street parking around it. We highly encourage public transit and carpooling -- feel free to start a carpool thread in the comments below! Parking is difficult. If at all possible we recommend that you take the T and walk to event. If you are coming from far away you should drive to Alewife and park in the garage there, take the redline to Central Square, and walk to the dance. If you need to park in central your best option is one of the five pay and display lots in the square. They will fill up.

Admission will be $7 - $15 sliding scale.

See you there!

results.description:
The first two SOLD OUT weeks of Best of Boston Sketch were packed full with weirdness, lunacy, and a bucketload of laughs. This week, three BRAND NEW ACTS will storm in to hit your funny place and make you happy you bought tickets ahead of time.

CONOR & QUENTIN: Two of Boston's funniest humans - Conor Allen and Quentin James - put together a mashup sketch set we hear will "go down" in the history books. Funny, filthy, and nutso bonkers.

AUTUMN & SUMMAR: Between navigating online dating, trying to seduce nerdy boys, fending off the common male douchebaggery and getting into girl-fights over a bearded bartender, Autumn Gillette and Summar Elguindy are forces to be reckoned with. This two-woman musical sketch comedy show is reminiscent of the stylings of Garfunkel & Oates and Flight of the Conchords. Using various instruments such as the ukulele, keyboard and children's xylophone, Autumn & Summar explore the world through the stylings of ballads, raps, folk songs and more!

TERRIBLE PEOPLE: Tired of hiding their true selves, the best sketch writers and actors in Boston have joined forces to create a show that pulls no punches, offers no quarter and spits in your grandmothers face and then makes out with her. Ben Scurria, Allen McRae, Ashley Voltz, Dave Grinstead, Laura Clark, Steve Delfino, Will Van Antwerp, and Matthew Fear ARE Terrible People.

WE SOLD OUT THE FIRST TWO WEEKS. GET YOUR TICKETS NOW!

Please note the change of date/time and location. 

Group run logistics: Please come prepared for a short run (or run/walk). Leave your bags, etc. at home or in your car so that you can run easily. Please make sure to arrive 10 minutes early to look for parking, find the location, etc. 
Coach will brief you at the beginning of the run about the distance and direct you through stretching exercises. It is absolutely OK to run/walk in the beginning. Many of us are first-time runners. So please don’t be shy :-). 

Program details:  TeamAIDAsha is a beginner-friendly marathon/half-marathon training and fund-raising program. We train runners for their full or half marathon races and runners raise donations for AID and Asha. Both beginner and experienced runners are welcome. Anyone is welcome to RSVP and join us for the group runs up to four time with no obligations. We request formal registrations after attending four group runs.

If you missed the information session you can get an overview of this training and fund-raising program from here.

Looking for more runners: We are always looking for more runners. If any of your friends, family members or colleagues to give us a try and join this meetup group.


Waiver: Lawyers make us do this :-).  By running with TeamAIDAsha program you are agreeing to our official waiver at: http://www.teamaidasha.org/waiver.html


About AID-Boston

Association for India's Development (AID) is a non-profit, volunteer movement committed to promoting sustainable, equitable and just development, especially at India’s grassroots. We meet once a week at MIT. Anyone is welcome to attend. Visit AID-Boston at: www.aidboston.org

About Asha-MIT

Asha tries to catalyze socio-economic change in India through education of underprivileged children. We meet once a month at MIT. Anyone is welcome to attend. Visit Asha Boston/MIT at: http://www.ashanet.org/mit/

results.description:
Organizer: Steve Blum @ [masked])


=========================

Read the entire description before you RSVP and answer all of the questions that are part of the RSVP process. I need to determine that you have successfully completed hikes of similar duration and vertical climb in the recent past.  Failure to answer them will result in your removal from this event. Sometimes the questions won't show up if you use a phone or tablet to RSVP so use a computer. 

If you underestimate the demands of this event; overestimate your experience, knowledge, skills or abilities; or come unprepared you put yourself as well as others at risk so consider this before you decide to participate. Contact me if you have any questions. 

=========================

What We're Doing...

The plan is to climb three of the NH 4,000 Footers - Jackson (#38 @ 4,052') Pierce (#27 @ 4,310')and Eisenhower (#11 @ 4780)


We will spot some cars at the Edmunds Path Trailhead, and then drive to the Webster-Jackson Trailhead where we will begin the hike. We will climb to the summit of Mt. Jackson on the Webster-Jackson Trail, continue on the Webster Cliff Trail to the summit of Mt. Pierce passing the Mizpah Hut just before the steep ascent to the summit of Pierce. Just beyond Mt. Pierce, we will reach the Crawford Path and follow it to Mt. Eisenhower, reaching the summit  via the Eisenhower Loop Trail. We will then descend this peak on the Edmunds Path, to the our awaiting vehicles.


Since you are ultimately responsible for your own safety you will need to become self-reliant by learning about the route and potential hazards.

Use this link for the current weather forecast:

http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=44.226446241000474&lon=-71.36590570299967#.VgX-EJd2GSo

Guests are not permitted - all participants must be members of the group.


Dogs are permitted only with the  approval of the leader.  Some features of the trails on this hike are not dog friendly.

On this moderate pace (~2.0 MPH) trip we will hike about 10 miles and climb about 4121 feet. It should take an average hiker about 7 hours to complete this trip. This event is considered to be INTERMEDIATE because of the pace, distance, and elevation gain.

We start as a group, hike as a group, and finish as a group. Our pace will be that of the slowest hiker. This trip isn't for you if you are faster than the group and don't want to stay with us, if you want to head off on your own, or if you are slower than the group and expect us to constantly wait for you.

What to Bring...

Use this link for a list of items needed for 3- season day hike:

• http://files.meetup.com/492954/Three_Season_Dayhike_gear_list.pdf

Do not rely on others to have extra items to share with you at the meeting spot or on the trail. You should know how to use all of your equipment - test and adjust it prior to this trip. 

Directions...


As previously noted, we will meet in the parking lot of the Edmunds Path Trailhead on the Mt. Clinton Rd. off Route 302 opposite the AMC Highland Center. Since this is where we will finish we will take the short drive back to the Webster-Jackson Trailhead on Rt. 302.  According to Google Maps this meeting spot is 162 miles from Boston and it should take about 2 hours 45 minutes to drive there.

Use this link for customizable driving directions:

https://www.google.com/maps/place/Mt+Clinton+Rd,+Jefferson,+NH+03583/@44.2478237,-71.3918819,17z


While carpooling is encouraged you are responsible for coordinating your own rides. Use the comments section below to communicate with others who may also be looking to share a ride. If you do share a ride be sure to share the expenses (gas and tolls).

Random Group of Hikers Disclaimer...

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hike Safe Responsibility Code; the organizer(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
results.name: NH4K ... Mts. Jackson, Pierce and Eisenhower (Intermediate)

results.description:
UPDATE: 

I am excited to post this update, hope to see you all soon.


We will leave Boston Area at 8:00AM, we should be back by 6:00 - 6:30PM. Depending on how well we do on time, we will stop by for dinner in Keene, NH. there is  a $5 Fee for the national park, and if you are taking a ride from someone, a $10 donation will be appreciated.

If you are riding with someone, It is your responsibility to stay in touch with the person driving you and letting them know of the status and ANY delays as soon as you find out. We have a long fun day of hiking and sightseeing ahead of us and waiting for anyone is not very exciting.


WHAT TO BRING:

I recommend bringing a jacket, plenty of water for yourself and trail mix or another form of snacks in a light backpack, not to mention Hiking shoes, and $5 Park fee. Important!

FINAL DESTINATION:

Monadnock State Park

116 Poole Rd

Jaffrey, NH 03452

================================

The view from Mt. Monadnock is as spectacular as New England's Fall colors go. I was so mesmerized the last time I went as I hiked past the treeline that I did not feel like pulling my camera out of my bag to take pictures (..I eventually did).

Monadnock literally stands alone, unlike most mountains that are in clusters in NE. Due to its great visibility, Mt. Monadnock is divine in all its glory.

We will do the White Dot Trail on Mt. Monadnock to reach the summit.

White Dot Trail on Mt. Monadnock, Jaffrey.

I will post the initial meetup location once the date approaches.

Bring Hiking Shoes and Comfortable clothes. There is a great Thai place in Keene where we can eat a well deserved dinner afterwards!
results.name: Fall Foliage Fun. Mt. Monadnock Hike
